abstract: The hedge fund owned by Steven A. Cohen has agreed to pay a record $1.2 billion penalty, becoming the first large Wall Street firm in a generation to confess to criminal conduct.
snippet: The hedge fund owned by Steven A. Cohen has agreed to pay a record $1.2 billion penalty, becoming the first large Wall Street firm in a generation to confess to criminal conduct.
lead_paragraph: The hedge fund titan Steven A. Cohen sat at the center of his vast trading floor on Monday, buying and selling stocks. In a sign of his enduring influence on Wall Street, he did business with major banks like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: $1.2 Billion Fine for Hedge Fund SAC Capital in Insider Case
headline.print_headline:
$1.2 Billion Fine
for Hedge Fund
in Insider Case

byline.original: By Peter Lattman and Ben Protess
